name: Stack
shortDesc: Creates an AWS OpsWorks stack. An AWS OpsWorks stack represents a set of instances that you want to manage collectively, typically because they have a common purpose such as serving PHP applications.

properties.name: AgentVersion
properties.desc: The AWS OpsWorks agent version that you want to use. The agent communicates with the service and handles tasks such as initiating Chef runs in response to lifecycle events. For valid values, see the AgentVersion parameter for the CreateStack action in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: Attributes
properties.desc: One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes bag.

properties.name: ChefConfiguration
properties.desc: Describes the Chef configuration. For more information, see the CreateStack ChefConfiguration parameter in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: ConfigurationManager
properties.desc: Describes the configuration manager. When you create a stack, you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version. For supported Chef versions, see the CreateStack ConfigurationManager parameter in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: CustomCookbooksSource
properties.desc: Contains the information required to retrieve a cookbook from a repository.

properties.name: CustomJson
properties.desc: A user-defined custom JSON object. The custom JSON is used to override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values. For more information, see CreateStack in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: DefaultAvailabilityZone
properties.desc: The stack's default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified region.

properties.name: DefaultInstanceProfileArn
properties.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM instance profile that is the default profile for all of the stack's Amazon EC2 instances.

properties.name: DefaultOs
properties.desc: The stack's default operating system. For more information, see CreateStack in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: DefaultRootDeviceType
properties.desc: The default root device type. This value is used by default for all instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see CreateStack in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: DefaultSshKeyName
properties.desc: A default SSH key for the stack instances. You can override this value when you create or update an instance.

properties.name: DefaultSubnetId
properties.desc: The stack's default subnet ID. All instances are launched into this subnet unless you specify another subnet ID when you create the instance.

properties.name: HostnameTheme
properties.desc: The stack's host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores. The theme is used to generate host names for the stack's instances. For more information, see CreateStack in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: Name
properties.desc: The name of the AWS OpsWorks stack.

properties.name: ServiceRoleArn
properties.desc: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS OpsWorks uses to work with AWS resources on your behalf. You must specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an existing IAM role.

properties.name: UseCustomCookbooks
properties.desc: Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

properties.name: UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
properties.desc: Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks built-in security groups with the stack's layers.

properties.name: VpcId
properties.desc: The ID of the VPC that the stack is to be launched into, which must be in the specified region. All instances are launched into this VPC. If you specify this property, you must specify the DefaultSubnetId property.
